RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HEY BOOTS took over toward the half mile pole and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the quarter, rounded the turn near the rail and was kept sharp in the lane. ONE WAY FARRIOR chased toward the inside, raced at the rail on the turn and finished well, though, settled for second best. SISYPHUS chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn then flattened in the lane. HAMMER gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path and showed little in the lane. P B FOXY chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail and showed little in the stretch. GOLD DILEMMA gave chase, raced in the two and three paths on the turn and proved empty for the stretch run. TECH DUINN bobbled at the break, picked up the chase outside then weakened in the five path on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Hey Boots
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,pressured rail into turn,kept sharp lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 7800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE SEPTEMBER 14, 2022. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 14, 2022 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUPERHIGHWAY settled back inside on the first turn, started a bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced four wide on the far turn, dug in for the lead in later yards and inched clear under the wire. NO FOOLING DUDE took over nearing the thirteen sixteenths pole and moved to the inside to show the way, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, cleared Fort Fortitude midway on the far turn but was met, and relented in later yards. EISELE rated close inside, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail then dueled through the stretch for third. FORT FORTITUDE stalked off the rail on the first turn, gave chase into the backstretch and challenged nearing the three eighths pole, but dropped back off the rail midway on the far turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. CHARLIE POTATOES raced in the three path on the first turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn three wide and showed little further. MOON OVER MONTANA rounded the opening turn off the rail, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and flattened stride.

ENTRY.NAME: Moon Over Montana
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased past 1/2,off rail far turn,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: No Fooling Dude
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Conrad Randall R
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,clear mid turn,relented late yrds

ENTRY.NAME: Superhighway
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside,bid 7/16,4wd far turn,up late,clear wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 51. Maiden Claiming Purse 10800. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MARQUET CLASSIC stalked from the three path then moved to even terms and dueled leaving the three eighths pole, took the nod approaching the quarter, raced clear past the eighth pole and widened through later yards. RAINBOW RHYTHM rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the half mile pole and dueled at even terms past the three eighths, ceded the edge toward the quarter pole, dropped back inside the eighth pole and settled for second best. MOONTAP settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn off the rail, then dueled through the stretch for third. JERSEY COAST raced in the three path the opening turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. WAVERLEY rounded the first turn about the four path, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, came through the far turn in the three path and showed little more. EVERYDAYISAGIFT stalked two deep on the first turn but dropped back and faded from the seven sixteenths pole. PRINCESS MIA ROSE rated close inside on the opening turn then faded through the backstretch. SCARLETT STRONG rounded the opening turn about the four path, left the turn outside and showed little response.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLUE N GOLD took over at the rail into the first turn, was met into the backstretch but recovered the nod toward the three eighths pole, dueled clear approaching the quarter pole, dug in under steady encouragement and just lasted. S S SPARTAN ENERGY settled off the rail on the first turn, bid approaching the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn about the six path, dueled clear for second later yards and just missed in a strong finish. SARGENT KOBE eased out into the first turn then corrected course and raced off the rail through the turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail, eased outward through the turn, entered the stretch four wide and came along for third later yards. WINDSOR'S TRACKER stalked the early leader three wide and took a brief lead into the backstretch, but was met and gave chase toward the three eighths pole, raced two deep on the far turn then flattened the final sixteenth. DANNY'S WINKSTER stalked two deep while between horses on the first turn, challenged leaving the half mile pole but dropped back at the five sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and flattened stride in the lane. LIL MR MATT was forced out into the opening turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole then weakened in the three path on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Sargent Kobe
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail early,chased 3/8,rail far turn,4wd 1/8,along 3rd late

ENTRY.NAME: Blue N Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Funkhouser III, Raymond J. and Funkhouser, John C.

ENTRY.NAME: S S Spartan Energy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 3/8,6p far turn,clear 2nd late,strong finish

ENTRY.NAME: Windsor's Tracker
ENTRY.OWNER: Julia John Take A Shot LLC and Joy Kevin J

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 92. Starter Allowance Purse 18600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE SEPTEMBER 14, 2021. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 14 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races W here Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RIDICULOUS saved ground on the first turn, started a bid toward the seven sixteenths pole and steadily improved from that point, entered the far turn near the rail, eased to the four path approaching the head of the lane, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and held on well. JAYJAYDEE raced in the four path the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn about the five path, dug in from the head of the lane and dueled through later yards for second. HAGLER saved ground on the first turn, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was outfinished for second later yards. UNCAPTURED KING rounded the opening turn about the five path, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, had range on the leaders leaving the turn but flattened stride inside the sixteenth pole. RAISE A SPEIGHTS took over nearing the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths, rounded the far turn near the rail, dug in leaving the turn but was met toward mid-stretch and weakened the final sixteenth. MONTAUK DADDY rated close off the rail, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path then flattened stride. DR. RUSTY RAYMOND was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Uncaptured King
ENTRY.OWNER: Murdock Stephen and Marceda John A

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MARCH 14, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since March 14 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 , if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THUNDERTURTLE raced in the three path the opening turn, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole and dueled close off the rail on the far turn, dug in for the lead mid-stretch, drew clear later yards and held on well. SHERIFF'S KID raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole and dueled close in the four path on the far turn, dueled for second later yards and was gaining on the winner. CRUZ IN THE CASTLE rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole and contested the edge closest to the rail on the far turn, but was met mid-stretch and flattened later yards. TIZBIT saved ground off the pace, bid leaving the three eighths pole, entered the far turn off the rail, was eased to the five path approaching the top of the lane but flattened in the drive. CENTERFOLD ANGEL rated close inside on the opening turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn off the rail, but weakened the final sixteenth. CHINA CAT saved ground and bid only mildly from the three eighths pole. SHES SO SPEIGHTSY rounded the opening turn in the three path, gave chase toward the three eighths pole then faded through the far turn. BONNIE BLUETOOTH stalked off the rail the first turn, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole but dropped back at the three eighths, checked into the far turn and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Centerfold Angel
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Shake and Bake Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,weakened 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Sheriff's Kid
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 7/16,close 4p far turn,dueled 2nd later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners O f A Race Since August 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 14 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CAJUN COUSIN gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail, eased out leaving the turn, dug in to get up and raced clear the final yards. MYGIDGETMARIE chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn, angled to the five path toward the head of the lane and dug in to take second the final yards. SHUTUPN'KISSME contested the pace at even terms, raced in the three path on the turn and remained a factor to deep stretch before flattening stride. MUSIC LASS pressured the pace at even terms while between horses, moved to the rail toward the head of the lane and weakened inside the sixteenth pole. AIM'S JUBILEE chased outside, rounded the turn about the five path and finished well. CASTLE TOY pressured the pace at even terms and raced at a close disadvantage nearest the rail most of the turn, but checked off the heels of Music Lass toward the eighth pole and flattened stride. CHURCH KEY gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn and showed little in the lane. GOT ANY came away awkwardly and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Music Lass
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressured pace,even terms between turn,weakened later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Mygidgetmarie
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail turn,eased out 1/8,up 2nd final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Cajun Cousin
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,rail turn,eased out 1/8,dug in lane,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Shutupn'kissme
ENTRY.COMMENT: contested pace,even terms 3p turn,factor to late lane,flattened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 14 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TALENTED CORINNA chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and inched clear under the wire. CURLIN'S DOVE pressured the pace inside, contested at a close disadvantage nearest the rail on the turn then dueled through the stretch for second while outfinished for the win. MIDNIGHT PASS set a pressured pace through the backstretch, contested the edge in the three path on the turn, was met entering the stretch then outfinished in the duel through the stretch. GREAT DEVOTION pressured the pace through most of the backstretch but dropped back past the five sixteenths pole, rounded the turn off the rail and ran evenly in the lane. EXCLUSIVE ROSE gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. TAKE CHARGE LISA pressured the pace through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path and weakened in the lane. AMERICAS WOMAN was sluggish into stride, rounded the turn about the five path and left the turn outside. SPUNKY ZOEY gave chase to no avail.

ENTRY.NAME: Talented Corinna
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell Kim and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Great Devotion
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,dropped back past 5/16,off rail turn,evenly lane
